Course Description: DESIGNED FOR NON-ACCOUNTING MAJORS, THIS COURSE FOCUSES ON HOW MANAGERS USE QUANTITATIVE AND QUALITATIVE ACCOUNTING INFORMATION FOR DECISION-MAKING.  STUDENTS WILL STUDY PRODUCT, SERVICE, AND ACTIVITY BASED COSTING; ANALYZE COSTS FOR BUDGETING AND PRICING DECISIONS; EVALUATE PERFORMANCE USING FINANCIAL AND NON-FINANCIAL MEASURE AND REPORTS; AND PRACTICE MAKING A VARIETY OF SHORT-TERM AND LONG-TERM MANAGERIAL DECISIONS.  THE COURSE EMPLOYS TECHNOLOGY TOOLS TYPICALLY USED BY MANAGERS, I.E., SPREADSHEET SOFTWARE AND THE INTERNET.
Textbook(s): MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING, 2002E EDITION, BY NEEDLES AND CROSSON
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
